column5: My thoughts are with your dad & your family! Best wishes for a speedy recovery! Cheers, Dave
Good morning all. Thank you. Just heading out to the hospital.  I,ll be sure to let him know many are thinking of him.     Brian
He'll be fine, Brian...and with you there, he'll be finer. Give us some news please.

All the best to your dad, may it go smoothly and the rehab go quickly.  As one who has been on the table 15 times in 15 years for joint related issues, he will feel great when it is behind him. My mother in law had a femer replaced at the age of 89 and the next day they had her on her feet and walking, 2 months later she felt 100% better.  FLEX

All the best to your dad, may it go smoothly and the rehab go quickly.  As one who has been on the table 15 times in 15 years for joint related issues, he will feel great when it is behind him. My mother in law had a femer replaced at the age of 89 and the next day they had her on her feet and walking, 2 months later she felt 100% better.  FLEX

Pop will be good to go in no time. A few buddy's of mine had it done just a short time ago. One was with me for 4 days at Quinte last week, he said he never felt so good. I'm sure your dad will do just fine. Wishing him well Dave

Im sure all will be fine Brian , had my right hip, knee and ankle replaced this spring and after 8 months Im walking better than I ever did with my organic leg ,cant wait to get back fishing next year , best advise is get him up and about as fast as he can . When I go for my check ups I see the people that did their exercises and were up and about fast did alot better than the ones who didnt . Tell your pops good luck , hopefully no more limping and a end to the pain .

All went well. It took only 55 minutes and 4 large coffees. I thought he was just getting a freeze from the waist down(heard wrong) He,ll be in an out for most of the day due to the meds. I could see mudder was stressed this morning,but alls good now.   Thanks again for the well wishes folks.  Brian
I'm pleased to hear all went well Brian.
I understand from the two examples I've seen that those Blowes b'ys are tough "Sons O Guns".  He'll be chasing yer Ma around the furniture in no time now.  Great to hear that all went well, Brian.
Last night he was moving his leg with no pain. Im sure the meds helpped that.LOL.He,s to be up and about today.
Good deal Brian.  Glad to hear everything went according to plan.
Praying for a speedy recovery.  Hope it was successful.  I have seen some amazing results from these surgeries.

My pop (gunsmith) will be heading in for surgury tomorrow morning for a hip replacement . He,s been in alot of pain the last 10 or so months.Some may have seen him limpimg at our wedding party.Not a fun thing. I have been watching a few of them web cam operations.Looks like a simple enough surgury,but one never knows.  If you all dont mind throwing a prayer his way,I would be very thankful.
Consider mine done Brian...I hope all goes well...
Brian, wishing your dad a easy procedure and a speedy uncomplicated recovery!!
you know our thoughts are with you and your dad

Hail Mary, Full of Grace, The Lord is with thee. Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners now, and at the hour of death.   AMEN
will do brian it's a common procedure and he'll be doing fine in no time
Brian, tell your pop that hip replacement is a breeze.  You've got a PM too.
Consider it done .
A relative did it, it's pretty simple. Let us know how it goes Brian.
He'll be up and running in no time Brian  All the best to your old man.

Tell your Mom to start exercising now Brian! She's gonna need to be able to run faster when he gets that hip up to speed! lol  Step-father had one done a few years back. Peace of cake and better than new after a bit of down time.
I hope everything goes well for your pop Brian.
No worries Brian. My boss just had it done, and he's right back atter 5 weeks later. He said the pain was gone when he woke up from surgery, and he was walking the same day.  S.
Ill be thinking of him.
Best of Luck hope it goes smooth Richard

I guess things have changed over the years Sinker, and that's a good thing.  I've had both hips totally replaced, one in '94 and the other in 2000, and your boss is right, the pain is gone within days but I was on crutches for a full 5 weeks after each surgery and that was the worst part of the whole deal.
Done.
My Grandmother just had her hip replaced last year. She's moving a lot better now and feeling better as well.  I wish him a speedy recovery!
all the best Brian to your dad and family
And so shall it be.   My best to pop for tomorrow
Said my piece Brian. I'm sure all will be well.
He'll be up in no time.  Take care of him.
Done.  I have a few friends who have had their hips done, and it's turned out very, very well for them. Good luck to your pop for a speedy rehab.
Done B, I'll be thinking good wishes all day!  He'll be fine.  Joey
good luck to him...
